meanings.definition: One of a series of steps in a staircase.
meanings.sent1: The stairstep creaked under my weight as I climbed up.
meanings.sent2: She carefully counted each stairstep as she ascended the staircase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to sit on the top stairstep and watch everyone below.
meanings.sent4: His progress in learning to read was like climbing a never-ending stairstep.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden stairstep had a worn-out groove from years of use.

meanings.definition: To arrange or progress in a series of steps or stages.
meanings.sent1: She would stairstep her study schedule to cover all the topics before the exam.
meanings.sent2: The project manager decided to stairstep the tasks to ensure a smooth workflow.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to stairstep the cooking process to have all dishes ready at the same time.
meanings.sent4: His career seemed to stairstep from one success to another without any setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's training plan was designed to stairstep his performance gradually for peak competition.
